Automatic Gratuity of 20% will be added to parties of 6 or more and to bills over $150

Address: 1204 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Campus pub founded in 1936 serving Greek food & decorated in hometown college football memorabilia.

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "Decent service, friendly staff, daily happy hour specials for food & drink."
"It's a good place for drinks with a group but the music can be piercingly loud."
"Our family tried a variety of things from pizza to burgers, gyros, and more."

most_relevant.description: This is, of course, an iconic place for any of us Michigan grads.  I haven’t been there in years but we stopped by when we were in town for lunch.   Very nice to see it uncrowned as when I normally go there it is on a football weekend when it is packed.   Who knew that Steve Breaston was a fan of pulled pork and that Bo’s burger was with fried onions on sourdough rye bread.  Very nice lunch spot and great stuff on the walls.

Good service great guy at the door for security on Friday August 30th. Me my brother and best friend came up from Pittsburgh  for the game against Fresno state. The place was awesome it is a must go to if you are in Ann Arbor and especially a Wolverine life long fan. Thank you for make a good pre game night a great pre game night. Who ever was the security guy I didn't get your name dam glad to have met you we will be back. GO BLUE!!!!!!!!!!!!
The atmosphere is nice and there is ample seating. The food is reasonably priced and delicious! The bathrooms could use a face lift🤪

Great little place near campus. We popped in for a quick bite after checking out the campus/downtown area. Our family tried a variety of things from pizza to burgers, gyros, and more. The sweet potato fries were awesome! Everything honestly was delicious, only complaint by any of us was the pizza needed to be a little more well done, but it was still super  flavorful. We'll definitely be back.

Had to stop in for a cold beer ! Go Blue
Great UM college bar !

Really enjoyed this restaurant. The pizza was great, and the selection is very interesting, in a good way. I was nervous at first as I always am with restaurants that have a large selection of dishes, but you would think that each item on the menu is their specialty with how good it was. Loved the atmosphere, too.

The Atmosphere and the vibe get a 5* but for the service they get a 1* seeing we were given the menu and then set there for 25min and was never asked what we wanted to drink or eat as for the food 1* because we never got to try it but I can say I wished I cud have because the food menu was looking pretty good and the drink menu was fire 🔥🔥🔥🔥 one of the best I have seen but again did not get to try because after 25 minutes we just got up and left and went to the pizza 🍕 house and was taking care of right away food was good as was the drinks $310 with tip.               (( sorry maybe next time Brown 🟤 jug but just know your last on our new avatar of restaurant in Ann arbor))

The service and atmosphere of sitting outside was very nice. Especially when the street was closed. I wish I could say the food was awesome. It wasn’t bad but I felt it wasn’t as good as what I paid for particularly (ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich and my significant other ordered Pesto Chicken Sandwich).
